revised_title: A Case Study of a Musket-Bullet Wound and Its Long-Term Effects
tldr: Dr. Robert Fielding shares his personal experience of being shot in the head with a musket-ball during a battle in the Civil Wars. The bullet remained in his head for nearly 30 years, causing various health issues and complications, including a flux of sanious matter from his nostrils, pain on the left side of his head, and the appearance of tumors. Eventually, the bullet was discovered and removed in August 1672.
